channel.title: The wierdest distro i've ever seen by FAR
channel.description:
It's called Winutuxu (Some call it WinUtuxU, whatever.) Winutuxu apparently is a operating system that is windows xp at the same time as ubuntu, and i heard it was really good. The website for it is in arabic though (Ent gonna downlod anything that's in arabic :o). Translated it, the actual OS is in english, but the website is in arabic. Windows update FULLY works with this apparently, so i heard. ;) Does anyone have the balls to try it? Or has tried it? I may try it, but i thought this was kinda cool, so wanted to show you guys. The wierd thing is ubuntu itself is 600+ MB, and so is Windows XP, and the compelte package is only 699MB (So you can fit it on a CD-RW.)
Home Page (Apparently.) = winutuxu.fr.ma If you want it, DL it from there, thats the home page I believe. yes, as i said, its arabic, translate it with google translator. If for whatever reason it doesn't work, tell me and I will find a gigashare mirror.
[b]Screenshots[/b] [img]http://aycu19.webshots.com/image/26098/2001173995858708935_rs.jpg[/img]
[img]http://aycu10.webshots.com/image/29289/2001180675554188903_rs.jpg[/img]
[img]http://aycu12.webshots.com/image/27411/2001172023118045604_rs.jpg[/img]
[img]http://aycu25.webshots.com/image/29384/2000008135897573233_rs.jpg[/img]
[img]http://aycu10.webshots.com/image/27249/2000036555292871239_rs.jpg[/img]
So does anyone have the balls? :P

item.title: The wierdest distro i've ever seen by FAR
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“kloplop321, post:18, topic:145087”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=198750.msg1793184#msg1793184 date=1191234496]
In kubuntu just type ‘sudo apt-get install vmware-server’ Then run ‘vmware’

Easy enough isn’t it?
[/quote]
E: Couldn’t find package vmware-server
E: Couldn’t find package vmware

is there a special repository for this?[/quote]

Like rictoo said, it is in the ubuntu commercial repo, make sure that is enabled and go for it.

Read full topic

item.title: The wierdest distro i've ever seen by FAR
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I actually installed this in my VMware, and I really like it, if you have to use windows, at least this one has all open source programs on it.

Mopar loves his open source software, doesn’t he?

I would test it out but I’m already dual booting with Kubuntu/Windows XP. I don’t really have any place to put it. VMware seems like a good idea but I don’t know a lot about it. I guess if I can read a bit more and find out how to use it, I could test this distro. It looks interesting (kinda ugly though).

Read full topic

item.source: The wierdest distro i've ever seen by FAR

item.title: The wierdest distro i've ever seen by FAR
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Looks like they used nLite on a windows cd for some of it. I’ve messed with it a little, never took it seriously though, the program itself looks promising though as far as what it can/could do to the all mighty windows. :rolleyes:

Screens:
http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/nlite1.jpg
http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/nlite2.jpg
http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/nlite3.jpg

Kinda makes me laugh at how a 7mb program can reconstruct windows like that.
Also makes me feel that much better about using it as my OS -.-

Also, found a site that gives some pretty useful info on “Making your own XP”
http://unattended.msfn.org/unattended.xp/view/web/1/

Read full topic
